snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg called the program, which will be imposed in as many as 13 neighborhoods, the latest tool in “our assault on the No. 1 traffic killer — speeding.”
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg announces a broad expansion of the city's so-called neighborhood slow-zone program, which lowers the speed limit to 20 miles per hour from 30 in designated areas; Bloomberg tells reporters that the city's recent safety gains have driven annual traffic fatalities to their lowest rates since the age of horse-drawn carriages.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg called the program, which will be imposed in as many as 13 neighborhoods, the latest tool in “our assault on the No. 1 traffic killer — speeding.”

headline.seo: New York Expanding 20 M.P.H. ‘Slow Zones’ in Neighborhoods
headline.main: City Expands 20 M.P.H. Zones Across More Neighborhoods
headline.print_headline: City Expands 20 M.P.H. Zones Across More Neighborhoods
